page.topic: How to Remote Test an A5W/HTML Page on a Mobile Device
page.description: A5W or HTML pages can be tested on Mobile Devices using Remote Test in the A5W/HTML Page Editor.

section.title: Remote Testing an A5W or HTML Page

step.description: If it is not already running, start the Development Server. On the Web Projects Control Panel, click *[ui:[red] Development Server]* to start the server.
step.note: If you see a [green] green dot on the *[ui:[red] Development Server]* button, this means the Development Server is already running.

step.description: Open an existing or create a new A5W or HTML page.
In the A5W/HTML Page Editor, click the *[ui:[execute] Execute Page]* button.
step.note: If the *[ui:[execute] Execute Page]* button is disabled, you need to start the Development Server. Go to the Web Projects Control Panel and start the Development Server.

step.description: Select *[ui:Remote Test]* from the list of options.

description.p: Configure how the Remote Test URL will be delivered. The URL for the test page can be delivered in several ways: *[ui:Send an Email]*, *[ui:Display a QR Code]*, or *[ui:Copy URL to the clipboard]*. The last option, *[ui:Do nothing]*, should only be selected if you have done a previous remote test for the A5W or HTML page.

step.description: Configure the Host Name. If the device is on the same network as the machine (a home network or VPN connection), choose *[ui:Automatic]*. If the machine can be accessed outside the firewall, choose either *[ui:IP Address]* or supply a *[ui:Manual]* hostname (e.g. *[ui:www.mysite.com]*).
Optionally, specify any page parameters to include in the URL to the A5W/HTML page.
Click *[ui:OK]* to generate the hostname and deliver the URL.
Test the page on the remote device.
